properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the notification configuration.

properties.name: destination_type
properties.description: (Required) The type of notification configuration payload to send. Valid values are generic or slack.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the notification configuration should be enabled or not. Disabled configurations will not send any notifications. Defaults to false.

properties.name: token
properties.description: (Optional) A write-only secure token for the notification configuration, which can be used by the receiving server to verify request authenticity when configured for notification configurations with a destination type of generic. A token set for notification configurations with a destination type of slack is not allowed and will result in an error. Defaults to null.

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: (Optional) The array of triggers for which this notification configuration will send notifications. Valid values are run:created, run:planning, run:needs_attention, run:applying run:completed, run:errored. If omitted, no notification triggers are configured.

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) The HTTP or HTTPS URL of the notification configuration where notification requests will be made.

properties.name: workspace_external_id
properties.description: (Required) The external id of the workspace that owns the notification configuration.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: api_url
properties.description: (Required) The base URL of your VCS provider's API (e.g. https://api.github.com or https://ghe.example.com/api/v3).

properties.name: http_url
properties.description: (Required) The homepage of your VCS provider (e.g. https://github.com or https://ghe.example.com).

properties.name: oauth_token
properties.description: (Required) The token string you were given by your VCS provider.

properties.name: service_provider
properties.description: (Required) The VCS provider being connected with. Valid options are github, github_enterprise, bitbucket_hosted, gitlab_hosted, gitlab_community_edition, or gitlab_enterprise_edition.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) Admin email address.

properties.name: session_timeout_minutes
properties.description: (Optional) Session timeout after inactivity. Defaults to 20160.

properties.name: session_remember_minutes
properties.description: (Optional) Session expiration. Defaults to 20160.

properties.name: collaborator_auth_policy
properties.description: (Optional) Authentication policy (password or two_factor_mandatory). Defaults to password.

properties.name: owners_team_saml_role_id
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the "owners" team.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: force_regenerate
properties.description: (Optional) If set to true, a new token will be generated even if a token already exists. This will invalidate the existing token!
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the policy set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of the policy set's purpose.

properties.name: global
properties.description: (Optional) Whether or not policies in this set will apply to all workspaces. Defaults to false. This value must not be provided if workspace_external_ids are provided.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: policies_path
properties.description: (Optional) The sub-path within the attached VCS repository to ingress when using vcs_repo. All files and directories outside of this sub-path will be ignored. This option can only be supplied when vcs_repo is present. Forces a new resource if changed.

properties.name: policy_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Sentinel policy IDs. This value must not be provided if vcs_repo is provided.

properties.name: vcs_repo
properties.description: (Optional) Settings for the policy sets VCS repository. Forces a new resource if changed. This value must not be provided if policy_ids are provided.

properties.name: workspace_external_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of workspace external IDs. This value must not be provided if global is provided.
Note: When neither vcs_repo or policy_ids is not specified, the current default is to create an empty non-VCS policy set.
The vcs_repo block supports:

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: (Required) A reference to your VCS repository in the format :org/:repo where :org and :repo refer to the organization and repository in your VCS provider.

properties.name: branch
properties.description: (Optional) The repository branch that Terraform will execute from. Default to master.

properties.name: ingress_submodules
properties.description: (Optional) Whether submodules should be fetched when cloning the VCS repository. Defaults to false.

properties.name: oauth_token_id
properties.description: (Required) Token ID of the VCS Connection (OAuth Conection Token) to use.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of the policy's purpose.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Required) The actual policy itself.

properties.name: enforce_mode
properties.description: (Required) The enforcement level of the policy. Valid values are advisory, hard-mandatory and soft-mandatory. Defaults to soft-mandatory.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name to identify the SSH key.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) The text of the SSH private key.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the team.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: access
properties.description: (Required) Type of access to grant. Valid values are admin, read, plan, or write.

properties.name: team_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the team to add to the workspace.

properties.name: workspace_id
properties.description: (Required) The workspace to which the team will be added, specified as a human-readable ID (<ORGANIZATION>/<WORKSPACE>).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: team_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the team.

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Required) Name of the user to add.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: team_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the team.

properties.name: usernames
properties.description: (Required) Names of the users to add.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: team_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the team.

properties.name: force_regenerate
properties.description: (Optional) If set to true, a new token will be generated even if a token already exists. This will invalidate the existing token!
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) Name of the variable.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) Value of the variable.

properties.name: category
properties.description: (Required) Whether this is a Terraform or environment variable. Valid values are terraform or env.

properties.name: hcl
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to evaluate the value of the variable as a string of HCL code. Has no effect for environment variables. Defaults to false.

properties.name: sensitive
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the value is sensitive. If true then the variable is written once and not visible thereafter. Defaults to false.

properties.name: workspace_id
properties.description: (Required) The workspace that owns the variable, specified as a human-readable ID (<ORGANIZATION>/<WORKSPACE>).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the workspace.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Required) Name of the organization.

properties.name: auto_apply
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to automatically apply changes when a Terraform plan is successful. Defaults to false.

properties.name: file_triggers_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to filter runs based on the changed files in a VCS push. If enabled, the working directory and trigger prefixes describe a set of paths which must contain changes for a VCS push to trigger a run. If disabled, any push will trigger a run. Defaults to true.

properties.name: operations
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to use remote execution mode. When set to false, the workspace will be used for state storage only. Defaults to true.

properties.name: queue_all_runs
properties.description: (Optional) Whether all runs should be queued. When set to false, runs triggered by a VCS change will not be queued until at least one run is manually queued. Defaults to true.

properties.name: ssh_key_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of an SSH key to assign to the workspace.

properties.name: terraform_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of Terraform to use for this

properties.name: trigger_prefixes
properties.description: (Optional) List of repository-root-relative paths which describe all locations to be tracked for changes. workspace. Defaults to the latest available version.

properties.name: working_directory
properties.description: (Optional) A relative path that Terraform will execute within. Defaults to the root of your repository.

properties.name: vcs_repo
properties.description: (Optional) Settings for the workspace's VCS repository.
The vcs_repo block supports:

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: (Required) A reference to your VCS repository in the format :org/:repo where :org and :repo refer to the organization and repository in your VCS provider.

properties.name: branch
properties.description: (Optional) The repository branch that Terraform will execute from. Default to master.

properties.name: ingress_submodules
properties.description: (Optional) Whether submodules should be fetched when cloning the VCS repository. Defaults to false.

properties.name: oauth_token_id
properties.description: (Required) Token ID of the VCS Connection (OAuth Conection Token) to use.
